newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czechs, Vietnam sign tax, air transport agreements.
newsitem.headline: Czechs, Vietnam sign tax, air transport agreements.

text.p: The Czech Republic and Vietnam signed two agreements on Friday to limit double taxation and to allow better access for each country's air transport, Czech Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus said.

After a meeting with his Vietnamese counterpart, Vo Van Kiet, Klaus told a news conference that while trade potential between the countries was great, current trade -- estimated at around $20 million per year -- was very small.
"Both sides unambiguously expressed their interest that there would be a marked increase in trade relations," Klaus said.
Kiet, on a tour of central Europe with a trade delegation from Hanoi, did not attend the news conference after the meeting with Klaus.

Klaus said the prime ministers discussed a "very hopeful" contract for the sale of Czech locomotives to the Vietnamese state railways and the possibility of a Czech company building a cement plant in Vietnam.
They also discussed building Czech diesel engines for water transport in Vietnam.
